text:
Very short walk but the vibes are immaculate. You can see some ruins but it’s largely occupied by plant growth. Insect repellent is a MUST!!!

Also I just learnt that Thomson Park and Thomson Nature Park are 2 different places so don’t go to the wrong one!

This nature park is a gem with the natural greenery and history of the abandoned Hainanese village. The ruins of the old houses showcased some of the living condition in the early days of Singapore.
It is also part of the Singapore Grand Prix Street circuit before the famous Marina Bay.

Alight from Springleaf MRT Exit 3. Turn right after exiting and walked straight down to enter through the park connector. Nice, serene and gentle walk. Trails within the park have gentle slopes and minimal stairs.
This park has been left in its natural state with the ruins of the Hainan Village. There are many monkeys inside so don’t go feed them. You don’t disturb them and they won’t disturb you
Small nature park, good for short walks in the nature. You could finish within 2hours easily. A shorter route could see you finishing in less than an hour.
